name: Hotel Sacher Salzburg

reviews.text: Excellent location, professional staff, good restaurant, quite expensive (I was in a suite overlooking the river, so it had to be expected) but worth every penny. Fine luxury hotel.
reviews.title: Best in town

reviews.text: Just came back from a wonderful stay at the Hotel Sacher. They truly believe in personalized service. Upon arrival, the concierge provides you with a package of materials that would be useful to a tourist - maps, brochures, etc. I bought the very useful Salzburg card at the front desk. Someone accompanies you to your room to show you around - the rooms are small but very nicely outfitted. I had a wonderful view of the river and you really can't beat the location - just across the river (and a 5 minute walk) to the Old Town. Minutes after my arrival, housekeeping arrived at my room with a plate with a flower and four truffles on it. Usual five star amenties - robes, slippers, shoe shine service etc. Room service is of very high quality. Overall, would highly recommend!
reviews.title: Unbelievable service and location

likes.disliked: — Only one computer at business centre

reviews.text: Oh my, what a truly wonderful experience- a perfect ending to a holiday with friends in Poland and Austria.
reviews.title: Magnificent Experience- We want to move in!!!

reviews.text: We stayed two nights in the Hotel Sacher Salzburg but wished it was longer (or that we could move in!). Having stayed in some "interesting" establishments in Poland (Warsaw, Krakow and Zakopane), this hotel was a welcome oasis of luxury and outstanding service and capped off our holiday perfectly.
reviews.title: beautiful hotel
Lovely City Trip
reviews.text: The staff were incredibly friendly, helpful and polite- from ringing around various ski resorts to see if they were open for skiing, to organising a complimentary bottle of Sacher sparkling wine on arrival for my birthday!!

We are currently staying here for three days of Christmas holiday with our family. Lovely old world decor. However, they crossed over the line tonight on Christmas Day when my husband (a professional jazz pianist) decided to play a few holiday tunes at the piano bar. The other guests were certainly enjoying the music when a rude, stuffy old Manager whisked into the room and "ordered" the piano to cease. What a terrible way to treat guests and ruin our Salzburg Christmas. We purposefully did not show for our dinner reservations at this hotel with an attitude. I hope others will heed this warning that this hotel allows their opinion of themselves to get in the way of the guest experience.
reviews.title: Stuffy Snobby Austrians
Perfect place for Advent
reviews.text: The room was beautiful, the staff exceedingly kind and the Christmas tree in the center of the staircase with its fresh pine scent made for a perfect place to stay while visiting this charming city during Christmas market.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a good location but the city is very small so that's not a great selling point. The rooms are very small and so is the bed. One of the hotel staff had directed us to the on site restaurant in the morning saying the breakfast came with room. Come to find out when we checked out, it was NOT included. So we ended up spending about 130 Euros for 2days/2 people. In comparison, we had a fantastic dinner at a nearby restaurant for 60 Euros (with wine). There isn't an iron in the room so if you need to iron, you have to have them do it for you (not great if you are in a hurry). I think there are better choices in terms of hotels in the area...the Hotel Stein seemed nicer.
reviews.title: great service but not worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is worth the price as the location is close to the main train station (1 km) so is walkable during the day. Taxi at night (some taxi drivers are very arrogant). The hotel is very close to the old town, museums, shopping and some Christmas markets. The hotel staff is uber helpful and friendly, the breakfast included is very good, the rooms are very clean and large and they were veery accommodating with our baby grandchild. One of the best parts was the great internet service. We never had a problem as we usually do EVERYWHERE in Europe! The chocolate, sacher cake and fruit left in the rooms is a nice touch. The rooms are quiet and the view is great. They have some adjoining rooms, but can't guarantee them. This and the hard beds are typical in Europe! There is a lovely view of the river, but is it really worth the extra cost??? I would definitely stay here again! This hotel is up to 5 stars in North American standards.
reviews.title: worth the cost

reviews.text: My wife and I have the privileged to stay 1 night at this wonderful hotel overlooking the old town in sept 2012. It was arranged by our Company. Everything seems to be ok. Understand the history of this building, still using key to open the room, that is still perfectly ok for us. Safe was rather 'tricky' to use, need the reception to assist us to 'unlock' the safe! Aircon was not functioning well, was told the "coolest" adjustable only to 25C. Coming from a hot Asian country, even the weather was cold in Salzburg, we still find the room a bit 'warm', we just need to lower the temperature to probably 23C, but it doesn't work in this hotel.
reviews.title: What is your room no.?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent New Years in the Sacher and it was amazing. Salzburg is such a lovely city and over the perfect holiday get away. We booked the New Years dinner, which was delicious and the entertainment program including a dance next to the Salzach river with the city's firecracker show an absolute highlight. Rooms were spacious and beautifully designed. Loved it and would recommend it to anyone looking for a special place to stay in beautiful Salzburg.
reviews.title: Amazing New Years

reviews.text: As Salzburg offers a wide selection of hotels the choice wasn't easy to stay, especially with a family of four including two toddlers. But gladly friends recommended us the Sacher which turned out to be the best choice after all! Our room was spacious and with all modern comforts such as cable tv and individual adjustable air conditioning and family friendly. The breaksfast was very delicious and sumptuous with attentive service. We felt very welcomed and also would love to thank Gerhart from the reception desk who got us on a beautiful carriage tour around the old town.
reviews.title: Perfect Pick in Salzburg

likes.liked: — Family Friendly, Lovely Room, Delicious Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For my birthday my husband and I stayed at the Sacher and it was a true remarkable experience.
reviews.title: Beautiful Birthday Stay and Delicious Sacher Torte

likes.liked: — Service and attention to detail, Room was gorgeous

reviews.title: enjoyable but not suitable for babies
reviews.text: When we got there everybody was so nice to us. After having stayed at many other high-end hotels, I was very impressed by how much attention to detail the entire hotel staff worked -they even noticed my birthday and got us two complimentry glasses of champagne.

The room was beautifully designed with the beds beeing very comfortable. We also took the opportunity to taste the sacher torte in the sacher cafe and it was worthwile-we even got one shipped back home for the family.
reviews.title: Gorgeous location, but overvalued

reviews.text: the balcony was the finishing elegant touch. sitting outside having a cup of coffee while looking at the serene river set a wonderful mood for the day. almost everyone working here was helpful (with one desk exception), and eager to resolve every question. the room was oozing with european charm, comfortable beds and amenities.
reviews.title: civilized mecca
5 star luxury
reviews.text: great location and wonderful breakfasts.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: have just returned from a 4 day stay at Hotel Sacher Slazburg
reviews.title: beautiful, efficient and memorable

reviews.text: My husband & I had a "basic" room.. What a room. the bathroom was exquisite with lotions ,soaps etc. The bedroom had a large flat screen Tv although we did not have time to watch it..The decor is pretty impressive with luxurious curtains, matching bed spreads etc.. Very nice. Breakfast was buffet style but you could have every thing you could possibly want .Even the Sacher Torte and Champagne was available .
reviews.title: wonderful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate outside at the Sacher Grill and the food was basic but very good and not too expensive.. The staff in all departments were courteous and very polite. The lobby area and bars etc are beautiful with lots of marble everywhere.
reviews.title: Perfect in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a fabulous stay at this charming hotel in a charming city. The rooms are elegantly appointed with modern touches. The bed, linens, towels, bathroom, etc are first class....not old and stodgy as what could be with a classic hotel. Not a sound was heard from other rooms. Wifi was difficult to get anywhere else but by the door, unfortunately but the walls are thick.
reviews.title: Elegant without being stuffy

reviews.text: The location is perfect as all you need to do is walk across a bridge to the charming old town. The staff was totally friendly and helpful. Breakfast was the best we had on our trip to Germany, Austria and Switzerland.
reviews.title: Storybook City / Very Fine Hotel

reviews.text: The Sacher is an excellent choice for Salzburg.
reviews.title: Stunning Setting on River

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When visiting the storybook city of Salzburg, why not stay in the famous Sacher Hotel Salzburg, have some of their decadent Sachertorte (the best ever!) and enjoy one of the best views of the city possible. My wife and I have stayed here several times while attending the Mozartfest. The service is excellent, location great and hotel VERY comfortable. We strongly recommend it!
reviews.title: A hotel at the very top of its game

reviews.text: I spent 1 night at Hotel Sacher Salzburg in December while visiting the Christmas Markets with a friend. It was unforgettable! This was actually my second stay, as my husband and I stayed 3 nights at the Sacher in May 2010. The hotel was recently renovated and was absolutely gorgeous. My friend had a 1 bedroom suite which included a large living/dining room with kitchenette, separate bedroom and bathroom. My deluxe K room connected and was a little on the small side, but beautifully decorated. The bathroom was all marble and had heated floors. We both had a lovely view of the river and bridge. There was some noise from downstairs (I think we were over the bar/lounge) until about 2am, which was bothersome. We had drinks in the hotel bar and it was lovely and full of people. The service was very good, not excellent-the staff wasn't that friendly. The location of the hotel is perfect for walking to most of the Salzburg sights-it does sit on a busy street, but that wasn't a distraction. I would definitely stay at the Sacher again. Ask for a room with a view of the river.
reviews.title: Spectacular!
Good value for money
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I spent a weekend in this hotel at the beginning of October 2005 and, overall, we were not disappointed.
We got a very reasonable rate (approx. €150/night) for this upmarket hotel by booking at the last minute through the hotel’s website and so our expectations were not particularly high.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in romantic Salzburg
An Excellent Hotel in the Grand Style
reviews.text: The room was a standard double of a reasonable size (25 square metres). It was furnished with tasteful antiques which were not too ancient. The bed was very comfortable and the linen clean and crisp. The elegant marble bathroom had both a shower and bath. Of course, given the cheap rate, we didn’t have a view of the river and the castle, which many of the rooms must have. On the first evening, we received a couple of small Sacher Torten, rich chocolate cakes made by this hotel chain (which comprises the Hotel Sacher, Vienna, and the Hotel Sacher, Salzburg), which was a nice touch. There was a turn-down service in the evening, which we appreciated.

reviews.title: Elegance at an affordable price
reviews.text: The hotel is grand and furnished with antiques. It is well located, on the bank of the river just a short walk away from the old town and also a stone’s throw away from a house in which Mozart lived, which is now a museum. It has a café serving appetising cakes, a piano bar and a restaurant, as well as a small shop selling its cakes and various merchandise. This isn’t at all a happening place for young people; it’s rather staid and traditional. The common areas are pretty impressive – a mosaic-tiled floor in the lobby, lovely stairways and an atrium. The only thing I thought was a shame is that there didn’t seem to be any place from which to admire what must be an impressive view over the river and old town. All this space is probably occupied by expensive suites/rooms. So, instead, we were advised by locals to go to the café on the roof of Hotel Stein, a few minutes’ walk up the river bank, from where we were able to enjoy the view.

Had a two bedroom suite for family of four. We stayed for 3 nights and were not dissapointed.... ideal location on the river.... a stone throw away from the historical town.... and obviously great views.... specially, that we had a balcony
reviews.title: Ideal for Salzburg, if you can afford it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking is not provided on the facility, so we parked in a public facility less than 10 minutes on foot away... which was not a problem....
reviews.title: best hotel we've ever stayes in!!!

reviews.text: We only have breakfast at the hotel (buffet style)... OK but nothing to write home about.... for dinner, we elected to try the various restaurants available at the old quarters
reviews.title: Fantastic experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, a well kept and upscale facility.... really expensive, but if you can afford it, it is well worth it.
reviews.title: Marvellous Hotel & Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I travel to Europe every March and this was the best hotel we've ever stayed in. We had a superior room which was beautiful and luxurious with a river view and balcony. Soon after arrival a bottle of champagne and a tray of fruits and sweets were delivered to our room. The Staff was excellent and even had out rental car delivered to the hotel for us when we left to extend our trip into Bavaria. Breakfast was sumptious. I have never felt so pampered in a hotel in al lmy life.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel, hard to fault

likes.liked: — Classic style and elegant with modern amenities

reviews.text: Located at the head a the foot bridge across the river leading to old town Salzburg, the setting and views from the hotel could not have been better. Add a little snow for Christmas, and well, it was a stay of a lifetime. Modernly appointed rooms in a hotel that gives the feeling of standing still in time. Greeted by a 25 foot tall Christmas tree somehow wedged into the lobby. A great and helpful staff, a wonderful cafe and excellent restaurant. If you can afford this hotel, definitely stay here.
reviews.title: Old Time Elegance in a greate location

reviews.text: I took my mom to visit the Christmas Market in Salzburg just before Christmas. We arrived by train and took a taxi to the hotel. The taxi was about 10 Euro and it took about 10 min to get to the hotel from the main train station. This way we were able to enjoy the beautiful scenery and wouldn't have to worry about parking. Even though we arrived in the AM and just expected to store our luggage, our room was ready for us after a short 30 min wait which we used to grab breakfast just across the street. Our rooms was quite large, very quiet and super clean.We received lovely in-house chocolates, fruits and water complimentary. A very nice touch. The hotel assisted us with a selection of entertainment choices for the evening and even booked the tickets for us. Very helpful staff and made our visit very pleasant. After an all day stroll through the Salzburg Christmas Market and lovely concert at the Festung Salzburg we enjoyed a hot relaxing bath and slept really well through the night. I always love visiting Salzburg as the local people are super friendly, honest and very refreshing. Definitely would stay here again and recommend the hotel to my friends. Thank you Hotel Sacher Team.
reviews.title: Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 3 nights, including Christmas eve and Christmas day here. Stayed in newly, very tastefully, refurbished room with comfortable beds and nice linen, a little disappointed there were no tea and coffee facilities in the room and only available via room service but fruit and complimentory cake, including the famous Sacher Torte left each day. Staff were very helpful and extremely courteous.The reception area with it's beautiful Christmas tree, had a wonderful aroma of Christmas, creating a lovely ambience. This delightful hotel is perfectly placed with fantastic views of the old town across the river. The food was amazing, wonderful breakfasts including champagne and delicious Christmas menus with corresponding wines. A little pricey maybe but worth every penny. Salzburg is a perfect place to spend Christmas.
reviews.title: Elegance and charm at it's best.
A great experience let down by the room and the cafe
reviews.text: This was our first stay at Sacher hotel. The staff were extremely attentative and helpful

We had dinner in the restaurant - the food was beautifully prepared and presented. The breakfast was superb - with respect to variety, presentation and taste (the scrambled eggs were the best I have had in Europe). I want to go back just for the food. Unfortunately the Sacher Cafe was less than impressive - poor service (very slow and lacking in customer service even though it was not all that busy) and the traditional Sacher Torte was dried out and stale!
reviews.title: An Excellent Hotel in a Splendid City

reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at The Sacher last December, when we spent 4 lovely days in Salzburg.
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.text: Our main purpose was to see the Christmas Markets which were fabulous.
reviews.title: Fantastic!
Excellent hotel
reviews.text: We booked this Hotel following lots of research and after reading Tripadviser reviews.
Althought the Sacher is a grand Hotel and in a fabulous location, our experience was rather disappointing.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay!
Perfect - Unhesitatingly Recommended !
reviews.text: We had booked 6 months in advance through Thomson Cities and requested a a corner room with river views following this suggestion made in a review we'd read from a very satisfied guest.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you have the good fortune of staying in Salzburg, I could not recommend the Hotel Sacher highly enough.
reviews.title: old style Hospitality

reviews.text: From the moment we arrived we were treated like one of the family.
reviews.title: Absolutely great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although we didn't get a river view the room was spacious and clean, and the fresh fruit, mineral water, plus the pieces of Sacher torte was a nice treat. all the amenities in the room ...TV..DVD Player.. Radio clock with i-pod port were great and the Safe was really easy!
reviews.title: Elegant Salzburg

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel was very handy for the Old Town, just a short five minute walk across the bridge so if you forget anything its a quick pop back to get it.
reviews.title: One of the best!

reviews.text: The reception staff were great, helping us to arrange our great trips. And after you've dragged yourself around all day a nice relax in the bar to unwind was just the job before we got ready for dinner.
reviews.title: Excellent place!

description: Dignified Traditional Hotel, dating from 1866, on Salzach River in city center, 3 km from train station & 6 km from airport.
